bundle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a group of things such as papers, clothes, or sticks that are fastened or tied together
bundle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a small bundle containing mostly clothing
bundle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a number of things that belong or are dealt with together
bundle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: computer software, and sometimes other equipment or services that are included with a new computer at no extra cost
bundle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to quickly push someone or something somewhere because you are in a hurry or you want to hide them
bundle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: They bundled Perez into the car and drove off.
bundle.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to move somewhere quickly in a group
bundle.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Six of us bundled into a taxi.
bundle.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to include computer software or other services with a new computer at no extra cost
bundle.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Microsoft can bundle Windows Vista at discounted prices with its popular desktop application programs.
The company offered customers a single computer solution, bundling together hardware and software.
bundle.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The company made a bundle selling its old equipment to a smaller dealer.
bundle.translation[2].definitions[1].def: a group of products or services that are provided together with other products or services
bundle.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The $849 bundle includes two copies of the software, cables, and an electronic mail application.
bundle.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to provide a product or service together with other products or services
bundle.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Image editing software is bundled with many digital cameras.
